alert.note: Alert for Upper Koyukuk Valley (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued June 11 at 5:19AM AKDT by NWS Fairbanks
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH NOW IN EFFECT THROUGH MONDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by rain and snowmelt continues to be possible. * WHERE...Rivers draining the Brooks Range in the Upper Koyukuk Valley. * WHEN...Through Monday afternoon. * IMPACTS...Runoff from rainfall and remaining snowmelt has caused rivers draining the southeastern Brooks Range to rise to near bankfull in many locations, with water over bank in some low lying areas. Water from the Koyukuk will cover the old runway along the river in Allakaket. The Koyukuk is not expected to flood in Bettles, but will likely reach bankfull. Water levels will continue to rise into the weekend, possibly causing minor flooding in other locations. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Heavy rain has fallen on existing snowpack leading to increased runoff. Flows in rivers may increase quickly covering gravel bars. An increased amount of debris will flow down rivers. - Http://weather.gov/aprfc Those living or recreating along rivers draining the Brooks Range are encouraged to monitor river levels this weekend.
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be alert for possible Flood Warnings. Those living in areas prone to flooding should be prepared to take action should flooding develop.
